issue.title: [C++] Add function "aliases" to compute::FunctionRegistry
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-9286](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9286). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
The purpose of aliases would be to avoid breaking APIs when/if functions are renamed in between releases

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9286?focusedCommentId=17165543) by Ji Liu (tianchen92):*
Add a API like Aliases(const std::string& name, const std::string& aliases) in
FunctionRegistry? Can I take this one?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9286?focusedCommentId=17166714) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Or maybe just `AddAlias(target_name, source_name)`.
